Sorry for the quick and dirty review but just tasted this and saw that there is not flavor review for it. If you have additional notes PLEASE share them.

**Setup:** Narda Clone, Single coil  26g Kanthal @.7 ohms.  25W Power, Half wicked with Native Wicks Platinum Blend

**Testing:** SC Blackberry @ 5%. 70/30 VG/PG, steeped 0 days.

**Flavor Description:**  I got this flavor because of /u/thadentman's crackberry pie recipe on atf. I have TFA's version but I am a junkie and have to collect them all. I am glad I did! This is very different from tfa's as in it is very sweet, juicy and more a candied blackberry. It reminds me a lot of their grape flavor where it is like a jolly rancher or sucker

**Off-flavors:**  Nothing

**Throat Hit:**  Very smooth right off the bat


**Uses & Pairings:**  I would use this in candies and juice box type recipes. I would stick with tfa blackberry for creams and custards but this is nice for cocktails or lighter fruit mixes where you want it to be sweet. 


**Notes:**
This is really good. At 2% you get a full, lip smacking flavor. I haven't steeped this at all so I am not sure how it will change, but if it is like most fruits, it won't change much.

**Second Opinions:** [Someone on ELR said it needed a long steep to lose the perfumy notes](http://e-liquid-recipes.com/flavor/7474) but I think they must have been talking about fa blackberry because there is zero perfume in this whatsoever. 

[aforementioned crackberry pie](https://alltheflavors.com/recipes/30877#crack_berry_pie_by_thadentman) by /u/thadentman.
